metadata.name: Field and Spectrum Sensing
metadata.description: Exotic sensing modalities for perceiving electromagnetic fields, radiation, gravitational anomalies, and other physical phenomena beyond standard audio-visual perception. These concepts enable interpretability of agents equipped with specialized sensors for fields and spectra.
metadata.author: hatcat-team

candidates.definition: The sensory modality through which an agent perceives physical fields, radiation, and spectral phenomena that extend beyond typical audio-visual perception

positive_examples: The agent's field-spectrum perception detected the electromagnetic signature of the hidden device.
Extended spectrum sensing revealed thermal gradients invisible to standard cameras.
Field perception identified the magnetic anomaly indicating buried infrastructure.
The robot's exotic sensing modalities provided awareness beyond human perception.
training_hints.disambiguation: Perceptual awareness through exotic sensing modalities, not raw instrument readings

candidates.definition: Detecting and characterizing electromagnetic fields including electric fields, radio waves, and EMI sources
candidates.definition_source: EMC testing, RF sensing, field detection

positive_examples: Electromagnetic field sensing detected the high-voltage power line 50 meters away.
The EM field sensor characterized the WiFi access point's radiation pattern.
RF sensing identified the interference source disrupting communications.
Electric field perception revealed the charged object before contact.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active sensing and characterization of EM fields, not passive exposure

candidates.definition: Detecting and mapping magnetic fields from ferromagnetic objects, electrical currents, or geomagnetic sources

positive_examples: Magnetic field sensing detected the ferromagnetic pipe beneath the surface.
The magnetometer array mapped the local magnetic anomaly for navigation.
Magnetic sensing identified current flow in the concealed wiring.
Geomagnetic field perception provided heading reference for localization.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active magnetic field characterization, not basic compass direction

candidates.definition: Sensing ionizing radiation levels and identifying radioactive sources or contamination

positive_examples: Radiation detection sensed elevated gamma levels indicating a nearby source.
The dosimetry subsystem tracked cumulative radiation exposure during the inspection.
Radiation perception triggered withdrawal when levels exceeded safe thresholds.
Spectroscopic radiation sensing identified the isotope as Cesium-137.
training_hints.disambiguation: Perceptual awareness of radiation hazards, not raw dosimeter readings

candidates.definition: Analyzing electromagnetic radiation across extended spectral ranges including infrared, ultraviolet, terahertz, and beyond visible light

positive_examples: Extended spectral analysis in the thermal IR revealed the heat signature behind the wall.
Hyperspectral sensing identified the material composition from its reflectance spectrum.
UV spectral perception detected the fluorescent markers invisible to standard cameras.
Terahertz imaging provided see-through perception of the package contents.
training_hints.disambiguation: Perceptual analysis beyond visible light, not general color sensing

candidates.definition: Sensing variations in gravitational field strength indicating subsurface density variations or mass distributions

positive_examples: Gravitational anomaly detection sensed the void beneath the surface from the local gravity reduction.
The gravity gradiometer mapped subsurface density variations for resource exploration.
Gravity sensing detected the large underground chamber through its gravitational signature.
Gravitational perception revealed mass distribution asymmetry in the inspected structure.
training_hints.disambiguation: Gravity-based perception of hidden structures and masses, not weight measurement

candidates.definition: Using ultrasonic or acoustic waves to image internal structures, detect objects, or characterize materials

positive_examples: Acoustic field imaging revealed the internal crack structure through ultrasonic reflection.
Sonar perception mapped the underwater terrain and detected submerged objects.
Ultrasonic sensing characterized the wall thickness variation across the inspection surface.
Acoustic imaging penetrated the opaque material to reveal hidden defects.
training_hints.disambiguation: Imaging perception through acoustic fields, not simple echo detection

candidates.definition: Detecting the flux and type of particles including cosmic rays, solar wind, or atmospheric particles
candidates.definition_source: Particle physics, space weather, atmospheric science

positive_examples: Particle flux sensing detected the increased cosmic ray intensity during the solar event.
The particle detector characterized the composition of the incident radiation.
Flux sensing monitored the space weather environment affecting electronics reliability.
Particle perception identified the muon shower from the high-energy cosmic ray interaction.
training_hints.disambiguation: Characterization of particle fluxes and types, not general radiation detection

candidates.definition: Perceiving and mapping spatial gradients of environmental quantities such as temperature, chemical concentration, or pressure

positive_examples: Environmental gradient mapping followed the increasing chemical concentration toward the source.
Thermal gradient perception identified the direction of the heat leak.
The gradient sensor array mapped the pressure distribution across the surface.
Gradient-following behavior traced the plume back to its origin.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active perception and mapping of environmental gradients, not point measurements

candidates.definition: Determining the direction and distance to remote signal sources using array processing or time-difference techniques

positive_examples: Far-field signal localization determined the distress beacon was 2.3km at bearing 047.
The antenna array provided direction finding for the unknown transmitter.
Signal localization using TDOA estimated the acoustic source position.
Far-field perception triangulated the emitter location from multiple sensing positions.
training_hints.disambiguation: Precise localization of remote signal sources, not signal detection
